physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Chest auscultation revealed diffuse inspiratory crackles. Laboratory examination demonstrated a normal peripheral blood count and a slightly raised CRP. Chest radiograph showed a tumoral lesion in the left hilus.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Two weeks after discharge, the bronchial smear became positive for a mycobacterium avian complex (MAC) infection. Follow-up PET/CT scan 2 months after presentation showed regression of all lesions, with the large abdominal lesion exhibiting lower F-18 FDG uptake.
